intro: Plagianthus betulinus, commonly known as the silver tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and inland regions. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence on the leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. The silver tree is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
